title: A company assigned by SSA to pay my bills.
question: I have an organization assigned by SSA to pay my bills every month. What could I do if they pay my bills late, not put funds on my debt card for personal spending, not pay my electric bill for 5 months, no correspondence about my questions. Is this called misuse of funds? I pay them monthly for the service. I added up all the late fees I have had to pay because of the bill being paid late which totals up to $3,000 plus. Is there anything I can do besides getting another payee or payor (whichever) they are called. I am in the process of hiring a different one as we speak. Please let me know what kind of action if any I have. Thank you very much. Teri
answers: Definitely get out of this arrangement immediately. Then I would encourage you to seek resolution of this matter through small claims court.
Sounds to me like you are getting scammed. Was this arrangement some kind of debt reduction process? Contact a debt collection attorney to investigate the "business" you are dealing with.
Why not pay bills yourself? You are in control and you can pay online often and thus avoid late fees. Take it over yourself and not worry about others fees.
